subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok so im getting stuff on the spectergram

oo also they only image you saw me go crazy about was the mean man peeking =
what many faces did you see??

--- On Sat, 12/18/10, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolw=
orth@...> wrote:


From: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...>
Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok so im getting stuff on the spectergram
To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, December 18, 2010, 4:57 PM


=C2=A0 



No,=
 I don't think I am being too critical, but I may have expectations that ar=
e a little too high. =C2=A0I want to take my time with this. =C2=A0For my o=
wn understanding, I need to have a large sample size so I know not only wha=
t to expect to see, but what to look for. =C2=A0I have seen ITC snapshots f=
rom programs like this that offer full faces. =C2=A0I would be more incline=
d to believe in such an image as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that =
may or may not be eyebrows.


Even in your example of the towel, you get ha=
lf a face. =C2=A0If you have half a face (on the vertical plane, not the ho=
rizontal) you can extrapolate out what the entire face would look like. =C2=
=A0This is something I would like to get myself and I would consider that e=
vidence if it showed up in one of these programs. =C2=A0But, if you have so=
mething that looks like a forehead and that is all there is, then it could =
also look like a rock or some other such object.


I am certainly hoping fo=
r results worked into box sessions. =C2=A0Directing a session with intent, =
like saying "I am going to examine the sound waves of this communication in=
 hopes of seeing your face. =C2=A0Is it possible you can show your face to =
me now through sound? " is what I am after. =C2=A0If a positive hit like th=
is happens, then I will be jumping for joy. =C2=A0Another good example woul=
d be a name, lets say Tom, that occurs. =C2=A0If you get a positive affirma=
tion that the name you heard is present, then you try the same technique on=
ly you address Tom by name and get a face, that would be even better.


But=
, as it stands now, the faces as they appear are random at best. =C2=A0I wo=
uld be more inclined to believe that when these faces do occur , they are g=
oing to occur with a lesser frequency than multiple images in a few seconds=
 of audio like Ursula's example. =C2=A0If this where the case, there would =
be dozens, and possibly hundreds, of faces during a ten minute session and =
I just don't think that is possible. =C2=A0This is why I need to look at se=
veral samples to find out if this is the case or not. =C2=A0If these partia=
lized faces occur in multiples all the time, I would be more apt to discoun=
t it. =C2=A0But, if they are a rarity affixed to only a few clips out of do=
zens, I would be more inclined to believe in them. =C2=A0Sample size is eve=
rything. =C2=A0It is like listening to GBC. =C2=A0If you have never done a =
session before, you would be inclined to believe every stray radio signal i=
s a communication. =C2=A0Only by continued practice (expanding your sample =
size) can you start to
 rule out stray radio with any degree of accuracy. =
=C2=A0


On the other hand, I am very new to this and I could certainly be =
wrong. =C2=A0I will continue to plug sound into the programs and hope for t=
he best. =C2=A0


I really want this to work. =C2=A0As you have probably ex=
perienced, when they want you to hear something or know something, they mak=
e it very obvious while communicating. =C2=A0I am hoping they apply this sa=
me rigor to this new format to show us that they are there. =C2=A0If they c=
an, then the world of video and audio ITC will merge in one source and then=
 the skeptics be damned!


Tim


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 2:24 PM, Frank Sum=
ption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 




=C2=A0I think it's u=
nrealistic to expect every file to have faces and images. These faces are o=
ften just portions, eyes and lips, some have eye brows. Like all of this, n=
ot done for proof, it's for emotional impact.=C2=A0 I have this woman that =
shows up in towels, always just half the face. Perahps you are being too cr=
itical? As with all spirit messages, it's what it means to the experiencer =
that matters. Expecting full faces is like expecting the kings english and =
proper grammer in all EVPs. 
=C2=A0
F-S





On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 3:07 A=
M, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I saw a couple=
 which could be construed as images in the one series you had from SEA, but=
 nothing that knocked me over the head yet. =C2=A0I am going to have to see=
 a larger sample size before I determine if what you have witnessed is in f=
act a form or not. =C2=A0I cannot accept an image as paranormal without kno=
wing where it sits among the bulk of audio files. =C2=A0If every file has m=
ultiple faces, the I would have =C2=A0to say that there is nothing there. 
=


So, I will certainly keep testing with my copy and hopefully something wi=
ll really pop for me. =C2=A0I have run through about ten files (EVP and GBC=
) so far for intensive study and I still haven't got anything that I would =
consider a positive hit. =C2=A0I need an actual formed face, not portions t=
hereof, to consider an image real. =C2=A0This is the only way to discount v=
isual matrixing.


I have high hopes for this though!


Tim 





On Sat, D=
ec 18, 2010 at 5:01 AM, Ursula Kalin <kalinu@...> wrote:


=C2=A0=
 







Tim did you see my images???

<tjwoolworth@...> wrote:

To=

Date: Saturday, December 18, 2010, 3:26 AM 



=
=C2=A0 

I have Audition as my editor. =C2=A0I am going to have to try it o=
ut. =C2=A0Thanks Bill. 


Tim


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 1:00 AM, psi_resear=
ch <vilhellm@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I've seen live webcast of I=
TC sessions where GB output is fed directly into the mic line in on a compu=
ter running Adobe Audition with the spectragraph running. It was really com=
pelling to see letters and numbers, not images or pictures, but partial wor=
ds appear in the graph. At first it was I thought it was a software glitch =
but it is a repeatable event. It was on LiveSciFi which is run by Tim Wood,=
 he also thought there was some kind of code error but it happened on more =
than one webcast. 

So if anyone has Audition, just feed Box output right i=
n your computer and see what happens. I wanted to try it tonight but I have=
 Audacity and the spectragraph feature doesn't have that shaded appearance =
that Audition does so it's not able to render images or characters, at leas=
t as far as I see using the various settings.


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.=
com, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:
>
> I have tried numerous EVP f=
iles and short box clips and so far
> nothing discernible has appeared on e=
ither program. I still have a lot of
> hope though.
> 
> I don't know about=
 you guys, but I am going to try to work this in to a
> session tonight!
> =

> Tim
> 

> On Fri, Dec 17, 2010 at 4:23 PM, Ursula <kalinu@...> wrote:
> =

> >
> >
> > But I don't know how to save the image ugh...what if i just wa=
nt one part
> > of it..Im soo lost here..and excited at the same time LOL
>=
 >
> > 
> >
>

<DIV id=3Dyiv1238861356ygrp-text>
<DIV>No=
, I don't think I am being too critical, but I may have expectations that a=
re a little too high.  I want to take my time with this.  For my =
own understanding, I need to have a large sample size so I know not only wh=
at to expect to see, but what to look for.  I have seen ITC snapshots =
from programs like this that offer full faces.  I would be more inclin=
ed to believe in such an image as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that=
 may or may not be eyebrows.
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Even in your example of t=
he towel, you get half a face.  If you have half a face (on the vertic=
al plane, not the horizontal) you can extrapolate out what the entire face =
would look like.  This is something I would like to get myself and I w=
ould consider that evidence if it showed up in one of these programs. &nbsp=
;But, if you have something that looks like a forehead and that is all ther=
e is, then it could also look like a rock or some other such object.</DIV>
=
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I am certainly hoping for results worked into box sess=
ions.  Directing a session with intent, like saying "I am going to exa=
mine the sound waves of this communication in hopes of seeing your face. &n=
bsp;Is it possible you can show your face to me now through sound? " is wha=
t I am after.  If a positive hit like this happens, then I will be jum=
ping for joy.  Another good example would be a name, lets say Tom, tha=
t occurs.  If you get a positive affirmation that the name you heard i=
s present, then you try the same technique only you address Tom by name and=
 get a face, that would be even better.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>But, as =
it stands now, the faces as they appear are random at best.  I would b=
e more inclined to believe that when these faces do occur , they are going =
to occur with a lesser frequency than multiple images in a few seconds of a=
udio like Ursula's example.  If this where the case, there would be do=
zens, and possibly hundreds, of faces during a ten minute session and I jus=
t don't think that is possible.  This is why I need to look at several=
 samples to find out if this is the case or not.  If these partialized=
 faces occur in multiples all the time, I would be more apt to discount it.=
  But, if they are a rarity affixed to only a few clips out of dozens,=
 I would be more inclined to believe in them.  Sample size is everythi=
ng.  It is like listening to GBC.  If you have never done a sessi=
on before, you would be inclined to believe every stray radio signal is a c=
ommunication.  Only by continued practice
 (expanding your sample size=
) can you start to rule out stray radio with any degree of accuracy.  =
</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>On the other hand, I am very new to this and I =
could certainly be wrong.  I will continue to plug sound into the prog=
rams and hope for the best.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I really want=
 this to work.  As you have probably experienced, when they want you t=
o hear something or know something, they make it very obvious while communi=
cating.  I am hoping they apply this same rigor to this new format to =
show us that they are there.  If they can, then the world of video and=
 audio ITC will merge in one source and then the skeptics be damned!</DIV>
=
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Tim<BR><BR>

<DIV>I saw a couple which could be construed as images in=
 the one series you had from SEA, but nothing that knocked me over the head=

ne if what you have witnessed is in fact a form or not.  I cannot acce=
pt an image as paranormal without knowing where it sits among the bulk of a=
udio files.  If every file has multiple faces, the I would have  =
to say that there is nothing there. </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>So, I will =
certainly keep testing with my copy and hopefully something will really pop=

sitive hit.  I need an actual formed face, not portions thereof, to co=
nsider an image real.  This is the only way to discount visual matrixi=
ng.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I have high hopes for this though!</DIV>

<DIV>I've seen live webcast of ITC sessions where GB ou=

 At first it was I thought it was a software glitch but it is a repeatable =

nd see what happens. I wanted to try it tonight but I have Audacity and the=
 spectragraph feature doesn't have that shaded appearance that Audition doe=
s so it's not able to render images or characters, at least as far as I see=
